title: These are the travel essentials everyone forgets to pack, according to Amazon
text:

Visit St. Pete/Clearwater/Flickr
According to AAA, more than one-third of Americans will take a family vacation this year.
Between the upcoming warmer weather, and lack of summer break, millions of us are likely to spend some desktop time looking through potential destination spots on Expedia .
This is the time of year when millions of people are looking for something out of the ordinary to look forward to.
Most travelers have experienced firsthand the exaggerated gratitude for products that make our journeys easier, as well as how enormously frustrating travel inconveniences can be. If you forget something essential on a five day trip, you might not spend nearly half your trip without it, or have to spend much more for something you have sitting on your nightstand at home.
According to Amazon, these are the 5 things travelers most frequently forget. Take a glance through the list and maybe pick up some extras and save yourself some angst if you, like one-third of your fellow Americans, plan on heading out of town in the near future.
View As: One Page Slides Phone chargers Amazon It's the first thing we're going to mention, because it's one of the easiest things to forget when packing: a phone charging cable. Nearly everyone needs one, and with so much of our dependence moving online and into digital formats, having a working phone while we travel and while we vacation is non-negotiable.
Instead of relying on my memory during the hectic period before embarking on a trip, I always keep a spare zipped into the front pocket of my suitcase.
Syncwire iPhone Charger Lightning Cable, $8.99, available at Amazon Camera chargers and memory cards Amazon The whole purpose of bringing a camera on vacation is to help you or loved ones remember your trip, whether you're a few state lines away or visiting the Irish moors you've always meant to see in person.
So forgetting a memory card or a camera charger packs a significant punch. You can always find an overpriced SD Card at the airport, but having a spare in your suitcase will be something that you'll never regret.
SanDisk Ultra Class 10 SDHC UHS-I Memory Card (32 GB), $12.95, available at Amazon Toothpaste Amazon It seems like many of the things we use everyday and rarely pay any attention to don't register on our radar when we're packing, either.
One of the most forgotten items is plain old toothpaste.
It pays to keep this in mind since essentials are often the items with the highest markups in destination spots, since retailers expect people to forget them.
Since traveling seems to deliver everyone a little less fresh to their hotel door, odds are good brushing your teeth will be one of the first things you want to do.
Crest 3D White Radiant Mint Whitening Toothpaste Twinpack, $5.71, available at Amazon Hairbrushes and combs Amazon Similar to toothpaste, hairbrushes are something that few of us really think about when packing. As a result, they often slip our minds as we load our suitcases.
Unfortunately, this isn't a luxury item. If you plan to come into contact with wind, water, or don't sleep on your back, you're in store for some knotsâ€”especially if you're using the mini shampoo provided to you by the hotel.
This particular brush focuses on detangling hair for both adults and kids, so no matter the surf or the wind power you won't have to tug too hard.
Crave Detangling Brush, $10.77, available at Amazon Swimsuits Amazon At best, you forgot to pack a swimsuit and found out the hotel has a pool. At worst, you're on a beach vacation and everyone else is heading to the ocean after check-in.
Nothing ruins the euphoria of a tropical destination like not being able to fully participate in the activities you've spent the last few weeks eagerly anticipating. Rather than having to go pick through the gift shop rack or miss a day in the water, it's a worthwhile idea to have one stockpiled.
